div.l: They sowpen and þei speken hem to salas
And drynken ever strong ale atte beste
Abowte mydnyght went þey to reste
Wel hath þis Miller vernessched his hed
Ful pale he was for dronke and noght rede
He yexeth and he speketh þorough þe nose
As he were on þe quakke or on þe pose
To bedde he goth and with him goth his wife
As eny Iay he light was and Iolyf
So was hir Ioly whistle wel y wette
The Cradel at hir beddes feet is sette
To rokken and to yeve þe childe to sowke
And whan þat dronken was al in þe Crowke
To bedde went þe doughter right a non̄
To bedde goth aleyn and also Iohn
Þer nas na more hem neded no dwale
Þis miller hath so wisly bibled ale
That as an hors he fnorteth in his sleep̄e
Ne of his taile be hinde to toke no kepe
His wif bare him a burdoıı̄un a ful strong
Men myghten her rowtyng heren a furlong
The wench routeth eke ꝑpar companye
Aleyn þe clerk þat herde þis melodye
He poked Iohn and seide slepestowe
Herd þou ever slik a song er nowe
Lo slik a couplynge is ymell hem alle
A wilde fyre on her bodyes falle
What herkned eủer slyk a ferly thing
Ye þey shal have þe flour͗e of euel endyng
Þis lang nyȝt þer tydes me no rest
But yet naforce al shal be for þe beste
For Iohn seyde ye as euer mote y thryve
If þat y may þe yonder lasse wol I swyve
Som esement hath lawe y shapen vs
For Iohn þer is a lawe þat seith thus
Þat if a man in a poynt be agreved
Þat in another he shal be releved
Oure corn̄ is stoln sothly it is no nay
And we han had an yvel fit þis day
And sen I shal have non amendement
